bookTitle: On the Genealogy of Morals / Ecce Homo
bookAuthors: Friedrich Nietzsche, Walter Kaufmann, R.J. Hollingdale
Plot: The Genealogy of Morals consists of three essays exploring morality and its origins where Nietzsche makes ample use of his training as a philologist. These works contain Nietzsche's most thorough and clear expression of his psychological philosophy. This edition includes Ecce Homo, Nietzsche's review of his life and works, with the exception of The Antichrist. These two books are compiled, translated and annotated by renowned Nietzsche scholar Walter Kaufmann.
Characters: Zarathustra, Richard Wagner, Arthur Schopenhauer, George Bernard Shaw, Zeus (God), Friedrich Nietzsche, Ovid (Roman), William Shakespeare
